message: Very good - I like it...How do you drive traffic to the page - It talks about the idea but what about features or do you test that next?
lol you need another button for none of the above / suggest something else.
Having said that, good luck guys! :)

What is so cool about developing something that, three months into, you'll start feeling bad that you didn't develop that other–less voted–idea? This is typical "we wanna do something cool but we don't want to commit to it and be to blame if it fails". If you're so good, develop one of them, the one you're more passionate about.

Not trying to be a "downer" just for the sake of it… This just sounds way too much "let's see if this works" for me to trust any of it… :\
Except for While You Were Out Notes. Actually it would take commitment to make it succeed. But it would be very easy to make a simple version and then say that nobody wanted it.
I felt the opposite about it, levifig. What it reminded me of is that you have to be committed to an idea. All of those ideas require significant investment of time and talent.
@bat That's what I'm saying: crowd sourcing ideas like this detaches them from commitment. I mean, kudos to them for trying but… well, ya, what I said earlier! :p
@levifig it depends on where the crowdsourced ideas are coming from and how they are presented. I like the idea funnel but I certainly don't like every list of startup ideas I've found.

Some of the team members on that page have LinkedIn as their profile page. If you don't have them in your network (i.e. don't know anyone in common) then you can't see their profile. Better to link to their public profile page.
